image.altText: Children play in Ngukurr's public pool

props.synopsis: For those living in northern Australia, local pools are a part of everyday life. But for remote councils, the costs of keeping a pool up and running can be crippling, leaving some communities without a safe place to swim.Â

title.children: Calls for safe place to swim as community fears fatal croc attack

image.altText: The sanctuary's homestead pictured ontop of a hill in the middle of the bush.

props.synopsis: In the Northern Territory outback, Wongalara sanctuary is successfully reducing wildfires and lowering pest numbers using strategic burns.

title.children: Remote Wongalara sanctuary using fire to protect native wildlife

image.altText: A burning boat.

props.synopsis: More than 2,000 illegal foreign fishing boats have been picked up in Australian waters over the past decade, but the boats keep coming.

title.children: Why are so many illegal fishing vessels targeting Australia's northern coast?

image.altText: A woman in a floral dress in the sun.

props.synopsis: Women, the elderly and other vulnerable residents in Alice Springs say they feel increasingly unsafe after a string of violent incidents, and are taking steps to protect themselves.

title.children: Women, vulnerable residents act to protect themselves amid Alice Springs crime

image.altText: A young woman and an older man stand in a field.

props.synopsis: When journalist Danielle O'Neal revisited a sugar cane farm at the centre of a UFO media storm in the 1960s, she never could have predicted the scar tissue she would find.

title.children: Investigating a UFO mystery spanning 60 years

image.altText: Two sitting figures are seen in silhouette against the ocean and last light of the setting sun.

props.synopsis: Australians on the front line of climate change are fighting to save their vanishing ancestral home. Can a landmark lawsuit against the federal government save their way of life?

title.children: Life on a sinking island on Australia's northern fringe

image.altText: A woman addresses the media in a press confernece.

props.synopsis: A list of seven requests has been issued to the Commonwealth by NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro to tackle recent violent crime in Alice Springs. It includes a call for Centrelink payments to be distributed on days when takeaway alcohol sales are banned in the outback town.

title.children: NT chief minister calls for welfare payment changes in Alice Springs

image.altText: An artisan makes traditional West Javanese puppets called wayang

props.synopsis: An elite school will soon ditch a long-running language program, in a move experts say could be "ideological" and will leave Australia ill-equipped to engage with our closest Asian neighbour.

title.children: Elite school drops key Asian language in 'huge backwards step'

image.altText: weather map of australia shows temperatures of forty degrees for southern Victoria, 45C plus maximums over the interior

props.synopsis: A widespread heatwave has large parts of the country's interior expected to reach highs of above 40 degrees Celsius throughout the day on Monday. See what's happening in your state.

title.children: Extreme heat, fire danger, storms and dangerous winds hit in one day

image.altText: A female mine worker walks past a mine dump truck at a coal mine in central Queensland.

props.synopsis: Wednesday's update to the budget will reveal billions less in tax is expected from the mining sector, as the government sets expectations for a coming decade of budgets in deficit.

title.children: $100b blow to mining exports to knock billions out of government coffers

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair and glasses stands behind a lectern with two small microphones.

props.synopsis: The head of Bendigo Bank and an Australian National University professor will replace two Reserve Bank board members in an overhaul of the central bank. It is likely to vex the Coalition, which claims any membership changes will be seen as an attempt to influence the RBA.Â

title.children: Two Reserve Bank monetary board members replaced under new-look RBA

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie looks into camera with a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: Whether it's "Faux outrage" or online death threats, it's risky being a whistleblower and vested interests have a lot to answer for.

title.children: Doctors have received death threats for speaking out about colleagues

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks into the ear of another man wearing a suit

props.synopsis: Foreign countries step up efforts to establish contacts with Syria's interim rulers.

title.children: Western and Arab nations intensify contact efforts with Syria's new de facto government

image.altText: Doreen Langham's photo on a cracked phone with lights and sirens in the background.

props.synopsis: Doreen Langham was set alight by her ex-partner in 2021 in one of Queensland's most horrific domestic violence murders. Could a warning from inside police ranks have changed the outcome?

title.children: Cracks in police record-keeping flagged before Doreen Langham's death

image.altText: Composite image of India bowler Jasprit Bumrah and cricket commentator Isa Guha.

props.synopsis: Fox Sports commentator Isa Guha says she is "deeply sorry" for a poor choice of words while talking about India bowler Jasprit Bumrah during the third Test at the Gabba.

title.children: Cricket commentator Isa Guha apologises for calling Jasprit Bumrah 'most valuable primate'

image.altText: multiple drones light up the night sky in New Jersey

props.synopsis: There are calls for new laws around addressing dangerous drone activity after thousands of mysterious sightings were reported in several US states.

title.children: FBI official says US public overreacting as thousands puzzle over mystery drones

image.altText: Screenshot of a Moochies watch for sale online. The watch face shows a woman smiling with 'mum' as the contact being called.

props.synopsis: The company behind Moochies watches is in liquidation, but the devices are still being sold despite mounting complaints of SIM card issues, GPS errors and difficulties contacting the firm for refunds.

title.children: Telco ombudsman concerned 'unwitting parents' buying Moochies watches

image.altText: Generic AFP Badge

props.synopsis: Senior Australian Federal Police detective Trent Madders will face trial in the ACT Supreme Court next year, facing three charges of aggravated perjury, destroying or concealing evidence, and perverting the course of justice.

title.children: Senior AFP detective to face trial for charges including perjury

image.altText: Close up of a glass jar containing blue ring shaped lollies

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old schoolboy who sold cannabis-laced lollies to another student was running his own "enterprise" from his bedroom, the Perth Children's Court is told.

title.children: Schoolboy found with 'all the tools of the trade' in cannabis gummy 'enterprise'

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 opens 0.3 per cent lower, dragged down by selling in the mining sector on falling iron ore prices. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Miners drag ASX lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Chinese data mostly disappoints, although some green shoots emerge

image.altText: A man with a bald head wearing a suit jacket and shirt stands outside in profile.

props.synopsis: Tim Pallas announces he is standing down as Victorian treasurer and that he will retire from politics.

title.children: Victorian Treasurer Tim Pallas to quit politics

image.altText: A river with very green water snakes through trees.

props.synopsis: Extreme heat forecast across western NSW has river rangers, locals and the state government worried about the possibility of another mass fish kill.

title.children: Fish kill fears as Darling River turns a sickly shade of green

image.altText: children play with building bricks

props.synopsis: Three Genius Childcare workers take legal action against the company over allegations it intentionally paid wages late and failed to pay them thousands of dollars in superannuation.

title.children: Childcare company sued over alleged 'deliberate' delayed wages

image.altText: A building with a sign on the front reading Wollongong Courthouse.

props.synopsis: A convicted child murderer has been granted parole for approaching a woman and her child at a NSW beach, but will remain in custody on a separate order to be heard in the Supreme Court.

title.children: Child murderer sentenced for approaching woman and child at NSW beach

image.altText: Four magic mushrooms in an outstretched hand close-up.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a close relative of the world's most popular psychedelic fungus suggests magic mushrooms came from Africa about 1.5 million years ago.

title.children: Magic mushroom discovery might explain how species spread worldwide

image.altText: ezra mam walking out of court

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old pleaded guilty in Brisbane Magistrates Court to one count of driving while relevant drug is present in blood, and driving without a licence.

title.children: Broncos' Ezra Mam fined after crashing ute while on 'cocktail' of drugs

image.altText: Rectangular bales of plastic recyclables stacked on top of each other.

props.synopsis: Billionaire and climate activist Annie Cannon-Brookes joins a growing opposition to a proposed plastic recycling project in the NSW Southern Highlands.

title.children: Billionaire Annie Cannon-Brookes opposes planned NSW plastic recycling plant

image.altText: Paula Abdul and Nigel Lythgoe at Goldie Hawn's Annual Goldie's Love In For Kids event in 2016.

props.synopsis: The singer was one of multiple women to launch legal action against former American Idol judge Nigel Lythgoe, alleging sexual assault.Â

title.children: Paula Abdul settles sexual assault lawsuit with ex-Idol co-worker

image.altText: Looking out to the valley from the level of the tracks over the bridge.

props.synopsis: Rail trail enthusiasts are one step closer to an exciting new nature experience, with plans underway for an extension of the scenic and historic Mary Valley track.

title.children: Rail trail extension hopes to attract 'wallets on wheels' to tiny towns

image.altText: Family members descend stairs outside a red brick building with green trees.

props.synopsis: Parents Georgina Burt and Andrew Dodt are the lead plaintiffs on a newly launched class action against the state of Tasmania and the operator of the Hillcrest jumping castle.

title.children: 'Our clients are absolutely heartbroken': Families launch class action over jumping castle tragedy

image.altText: A man wearing a suit looks sideways as he speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the regime change in Syria is fuelling the need to bolster the Israeli population in the region.Â

title.children: Israel plans to double its population of settlers in the occupied Golan Heights

image.altText: A single bed in a room at the new youth training centre

props.synopsis: Nearly one in two incarcerated children in South Australia have been prescribed a supplement to help them fall asleep, amid concerns about "unusual" night-time behaviours.

title.children: Doctors concerned by melatonin prescriptions to children at detention centre

image.altText: A red and blue oil tanker split in two with the vessel's bow pointing vertically up out of dark sea water

props.synopsis: Russia has opened two criminal investigations into potential safety violations after at least one person died and another tanker was significantly damaged in the weather.

title.children: Russian oil tanker split in half and sinks in storm in the Black Sea

image.altText: A man on a motorbike with the dog in a sidecar in a barren landscape.

props.synopsis: When ex-con Lang and a black dog strike up an unlikely friendship, even those with ambivalent feelings towards pooches will likely find something to connect with in this soulful, deftly understated film.

title.children: Xin the whippet will steal your heart in this Cannes-award-winning film
